description: Overview of the main health-check metrics from Confluent Platform components.

panels.description:
Quorum Size of Zookeeper ensemble.
            Count Zookeeper servers with quorum size metric.
panels.title: ZK: Quorum Size

panels.description:
Average size of ZNodes in the cluster.
            Getting the node count per server, and averaging the node count.
panels.title: ZK: ZNodes (avg.)

panels.description:
Sum of the number of alive connections per servers divided by the maximum number of client connections allowed per host.
            If the percentage is higher than 60%, then Zookeeper should be scaled and/or the Zookeeper clients should be investigated to find the reason for high number of connections opened.
panels.title: ZK: Connections used

panels.description: Sum of client watchers subscribed to changes on the ZNodes.
panels.title: ZK: Sum of watchers

panels.description:
Number of requests waiting for processing (queued).
            If the number of outstanding requests grows higher than 10, then the Zookeeper hosts should be checked.
            It could mean that there is not enough resources to cope with the number of requests.
panels.title: ZK: Outstanding Requests

panels.description:
Count of brokers available (online).
            This value is referential and should not be used for alerting.
panels.title: Kafka: Online Brokers

panels.description:
Active Controller broker.
            It should always be 1. If the value is different than 1, then it must be alerted for troubleshooting.
panels.title: Kafka: Active Controller

panels.description: Sum of Topic partitions across the cluster.
panels.title: Kafka: Sum of Partitions

panels.description:
Sum of Under-Replicated Partitions. This is caused by broker or volumes unavailable, impacting replicas to be offline, and reducing the ISR set for those partitions.
            There are transient scenarios that could lead to this number growing (e.g. broker restart), but if the number doesn't shrink in a short period of time (e.g. 1 minute), then it's recommended to alert.
panels.title: Kafka: Sum of Under-Replicated Partitions (URP)

panels.description:
Number of partitions where the number of replicas offline is higher than the minimum ISR configuration.
            This means partitions are not available for Producers with acks=all.
            It's recommended alerting when this values is higher than 0.
panels.title: Kafka: Sum of Under-MinISR Partitions

panels.description:
Number of partitions where all replicas are offline.
            Producers and Consumers are affected by this condition.
            It's recommended alerting when this values is higher than 0.
panels.title: Kafka: Sum of Offline Partitions

panels.description: Schema Registry online instances returning metrics.
panels.title: SR: Online instances

panels.description: Average number of registered schemas across the cluster.
panels.title: SR: Registered Schemas (avg.)

panels.description: Average number of schemas created, by type.
panels.title: SR: Schemas Created by Type (avg.)

panels.description: Average number of schemas deleted, by type.
panels.title: SR: Schemas Deleted by Type (avg.)

panels.description: Kafka Connect online workers returning metrics.
panels.title: Connect: Online Workers

panels.description: Number of tasks deployed on Kafka Connect cluster.
panels.title: Connect: Sum of Total Tasks

panels.description:
Number of Running Tasks on the Kafka Connect cluster.
            Ideally, this number should be equal to the total number of tasks deployed.
panels.title: Connect: Sum of Running Tasks

panels.description:
Number of Paused Tasks on the Kafka Connect cluster.
            Ideally, this number should be zero, as tasks should be running.
panels.title: Connect: Sum of Paused Tasks

panels.description:
Number of Paused Tasks on the Kafka Connect cluster.
            Ideally, this number should be zero, as tasks should be running.
            It's recommended alerting when this value is higher than 0.
panels.title: Connect: Sum of Failed Tasks

panels.description:
Informative value. Time since last rebalance.
            When this value is continuously and repeatedly low means some connectors are failing and rebalancing is triggered constantly.
panels.title: Connect: Time since last rebalance

panels.description: ksqlDB online instances returning metrics.
panels.title: ksqlDB: Online instances

panels.description: Number of active queries deployed in the cluster.
panels.title: ksqlDB: Sum of Active Queries

panels.description:
Number of running queries deployed in the cluster.
            Ideally, this number should be equal to the number of active queries as queries should be running.
panels.title: ksqlDB: Sum of Running Queries

panels.description:
Number of queries rebalancing in the cluster.
            Ideally, this number should be equal zero, or return to zero in a short period (e.g. 1 minute).
            It's recommended to alert if the number of rebalancing queries stay higher than 0 for a longer period of time.
panels.title: ksqlDB: Sum of Rebalancing Queries

panels.description:
Number of queries failed in the cluster.
            Ideally, this number should be equal zero.
            It's recommended to alert if the number of queries failed is higher than 0.
panels.title: Connect: Sum of Queries Failed

title: Confluent Platform overview
